course_title: Freshmen Seminar: Pers. &Propaganda in E. Asia
class_notes:
Persuasion and Propaganda in East Asia and Beyond: This course explores historical and emergent issues of public communication in East Asia, where distinct and multifaced rhetorical traditions have flourished for more than two millennia. Throughout this course, students will survey a broad array of comparative scholarship on public information, and critically apply them to historical and contemporary cases in East Asia and beyond. This course will help students developing a more nuanced understanding of public communication in terms of its sociocultural and ethical implications, as well as acquiring the necessary critical skills to evaluate information and disinformation across diverse audiences and cultural contexts. 
 
There are no textbooks required for this course. All readings will be available through CANVAS.
course_description: Focus on selected topics in East Asian studies.
